column5: Notify OESRC.  DOE uses this clause instead of FAR 52.204-2.  As prescribed in 904.404(d)(1), the following clause shall be included in contracts entered into under section 31 (research assistance, 42 U.S.C. 2051), or section 41 (ownership and operation of production facilities, 42 U.S.C. 2061) of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954, and in other contracts and subcontracts which involve or are likely to involve classified information or special nuclear material.
column6:
Negotiation Position #1 - Will Not Involve Classified Information or Special Nuclear Material:  This contract will not involve classified information or special nuclear material.  Therefore, it is requested for this clause to be removed from this contract for clarity.  

Negotiation Position #2 (after further consultation with OESRC):  DEAR 952.204-72, Disclosure of Information (Apr 1994) is prescribed at DEAR 904.404(d)(4) to be used in place of DEAR 952.204-2 in contracts with educational institutions for research involving nuclear technology which could but is not expected to produce classified information or restricted data.  Therefore, it is requested for DEAR 952.204-2 to be removed and for DEAR 952.204-72 to be included in its place.  Thank you.
column7: Yes, or clause substantially the same

column5:

column6:

Negotiation Position #2 (after further consultation with OESRC):  DEAR 952.204-72, Disclosure of Information (Apr 1994) is prescribed at DEAR 904.404(d)(4) to be used in place of DEAR 952.204-70 in contracts with educational institutions for research involving nuclear technology which could but is not expected to produce classified information or restricted data.  Therefore, it requested for DEAR 952.204-70 to be removed and for DEAR 952.204-72 to be included in its place.  Thank you.

column5:
This clause is required in unclassified research contracts which may involve making unclassified information about nuclear technology available to certain sensitive foreign nations. Virginia Tech is to be provided at the time of award the listing of nations referenced in DOE Order 142.3 or its successor. (The attachment referred to in the clause shall set forth the applicable requirements of the DOE regulations on dissemination of unclassified published and unpublished technical information to foreign nations.)
Notify OESRC.
column6:
After consultation with the PI and OESRC:

Negotiation Position:  Virginia Tech will not be providing access to unclassified information about nuclear technology to sensitive foreign nations in the performance of this contract.  Therefore, it is requested for this clause to be removed from this contract for clarity.
column7: Yes, this clause shall be included in any subcontracts which may involve making unclassified information about nuclear technology available to sensitive foreign nations.

This clause is prescribed to be used within contracts with educational institutions for research involving nuclear technology.  Since this contract's scope of work does not include research involving nuclear technology, it is understood that this clause does not apply. Therefore, it is respectfully requested for it to be removed for clarity.  Thank you.

column5: Required in all contracts

column5:
Used in contracts where Virginia Tech will be providing advisory and assistance services expected to exceed the simplified acquisition threshold.  This should never happen.  

“Advisory and assistance services” means those services provided under contract by nongovernmental sources to support or improve: organizational policy development; decision-making; management and administration; program and/or project management and administration; or R&D activities. It can also mean the furnishing of professional advice or assistance rendered to improve the effectiveness of Federal management processes or procedures (including those of an engineering and technical nature). 

This could potentially impact future research and development work at Virginia Tech.
column6: Negotiation Position:  Virginia Tech will not be providing advisory and assistance services.  Therefore, the removal of this clause is requested.
column7: Yes, required in clause

column5: In contracts in support of authorized DOE atomic energy programs
column7: not required in clause or prescription

column5: The contracting officer (after deleting “under the clause at 970.5203-3, Contractor's Organization” from paragraph (a) if not a management and operating contract) shall insert the clause at 952.215-70, Key Personnel, in contracts under which performance is largely dependent on the expertise of specific key personnel.

As prescribed in 916.307(g), modify paragraph (c) of the clause at 48 CFR 52.216-15, Predetermined Indirect Cost Rates, by deleting the words “Subpart 31.4” and substituting for them “Subpart 31.6” and insert the clause in solicitations and contracts when a cost-reimbursement research and development contract with a State or local government is contemplated and predetermined indirect cost rates are to be used.
Used in contracts where Virginia Tech would be acquiring or has proposed to acquire use of real property.  This should not happen.
column6:
Negotiation Position:  Virginia Tech will not be acquiring and has not proposed to acquire use of real property.  Therefore, the removal of this clause is requested. 

If the KO refuses to remove this clause, it would be considered to be self-deleting if we are not acquiring real property under the contract.
column7: Yes, if subcontractor is purchasing real property

column5:
This provision is required in all solicitations that are expected to exceed the Simplified Acquisition Threshold.  

This just applies to solicitations that expect the award of a contract on a cost-plus-award fee basis.
column6: Keeping this provision in a contract does not harm Virignia Tech.  It is self-deleting since we are never going to have a Cost-Plus-Award-Fee contract (and since it is a solicitation provision).
column7: No, clause says for Prime contractors

column2: Integration of environment, safety, and health into work planning and execution.
column5: As prescribed in 923.7003 the clause set forth at 970.5223-1 shall be included in all contracts and subcontracts for, and be made applicable to, work to be performed at a government-owned or leased facility where DOE has elected to assert its statutory authority to establish and enforce occupational safety and health standards applicable to the work conditions of contractor and subcontractor employees, and to the protection of the public health and safety.
column6: Negotiation Position:  Virginia Tech is executing research efforts.  It is not executing work at a government-owned or leased facility where DOE has elected to assert its statutory authority to establish and enforce occupational safety and health standards applicable to the work conditions of contractor and subcontractor employees, and to the protection of the public health and safety.Therefore, it is respectfully requested for this clause to be removed for clarity.  Thank you.

column5: As prescribed in 923.7003, this clause shall be included in those contracts or subcontracts for, and be made applicable to, work to be performed at a facility where DOE does not elect to assert its statutory authority to enforce occupational safety and health standards applicable to the working conditions of contractor and subcontractor employees, but does need to enforce radiological safety and health standards pursuant to provisions of the contract or subcontract rather than by reliance upon Nuclear Regulatory Commission licensing requirements (including agreements with states under section 274 of the Atomic Energy Act):
column6: Negotiation Position:  Virginia Tech is executing research efforts.  It is not performing at a facility where DOE does not elect to assert its statutory authority to enforce occupational safety and health standards applicable to the working conditions of contractor and subcontractor employees, but does need to enforce radiological safety and health standards pursuant to provisions of the contract or subcontract rather than by reliance upon Nuclear Regulatory Commission licensing requirements (including agreements with states under section 274 of the Atomic Energy Act).  Therefore, it is respectfully requested for this clause to be removed for clarity.  Thank you.

column5: Insert the clause at 952.223-78, Sustainable Acquisition Program, or its Alternate I, in all contracts under which the contractor operates Government-owned facilities or Government-owned fleets or performs construction at a Government-owned facility.
column6: Negotiation Position:  This clause is prescribed at DEAR 923.103 to be used when  the contractor operates Government-owned facilities or Government-owned fleets or performs construction at a Government-owned facility.  Virginia Tech is not operating any Government-owned facilities or Government-owned fleets or performing any construction at a Government-owned facility. For clarity, it is respectfully requested for this clause to be removed.

column2: Notice of Rights to Request Patent Waiver
column5:
In all contracts involving research, development, or demonstration work.

This provides a mechanism for commercial entities to request for the US Government to waive its rights to inventions conceived or first actually reduced to practice in performance of the contract.

The clause specifically states that entities like Virginia Tech, which is a domestic nonprofit organization, would not need to request a waiver if DEAR 952.227-11 is included in the contract.
column7: Not required in clause or prescription

column5:
When foreign travel may be required under the contract, the contracting officer shall insert the clause at 952.247-70, Foreign Travel.

Contractor foreign travel shall be conducted pursuant to the requirements contained in Department of Energy (DOE) Order 551.1C, Official Foreign Travel, or its successor in effect at the time of award.  

The current version is actually DOE O 551.1D Chg 2 (Minor Revision), dated August 09, 2016.  

https://www.directives.doe.gov/directives-documents/500-series/0551.1-BOrder-D-chg2_min-rev

Check with PI to see if there will be any foreign travel planned under the contract. Notify OESRC if there will be foreign travel.

Virginia Tech will not be engaging in foreign travel under this contract.  Therefore, it is requested for this clause to be removed from this contract for clarity.

column2: Part 970, DOE Management and Operating Contracts

GENERIC TEXT TO REQUEST FOR THE REMOVAL OF CLAUSES SET FORTH WITHIN DEAR PART 970:

In accordance with DEAR 970.0100, Scope of part, Part 970, DOE Management and Operating Contracts, sets forth DOE policies, procedures, provisions, and clauses that implement and supplement the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) (Chapter 1 of Title 48 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR)) and other parts of the Department of Energy Acquisition Regulation (DEAR) (Chapter 9 of Title 48 CFR) for the award and administration of the Department's management and operating contracts, as defined at 48 CFR subpart 17.6.

Since Virginia Tech is executing research efforts, and not executing a Management and Operating Contract, it is respectfully requested for any of the contract clauses prescribed within Part 970, DOE Management and Operating Contract, be removed from Virginia Tech's subcontract for clarity, as they do not apply to Virginia Tech.

column5:
In management and operating contracts  Alt I is to be used for nonprofit contractors.  Government ownership of all property purchased under the contract

First Position - Use the Text in the Cell to the Right of this one to request removal.  

Second Position - If Sponsor insists on clause's inclusion, review the budget to see if there is any purchase of equipment.  If there is, draft a Faculty Agreement documenting the equipment ownership terms.  For example, the first part of Paragraph (b) includes the following:

(b) Title to property. Except as otherwise provided by the Contracting Officer, title to all materials, equipment, supplies, and tangible personal property of every kind and description purchased by the Contractor, for the cost of which the Contractor is entitled to be reimbursed as a direct item of cost under this contract, shall pass directly from the vendor to the Government.

Insist on the inclusion of Alt I.
column6:
As defined within FAR 17.601, a “Management and operating contract” means an agreement under which the Government contracts for the operation, maintenance, or support, on its behalf, of a Government-owned or -controlled research, development, special production, or testing establishment wholly or principally devoted to one or more major programs of the contracting Federal agency.

DEAR 970.5245-1, Property, is prescribed at DEAR 970.4501-1(a) to be included “…in management and operating contracts.”  Based upon the definition within FAR 17.601, Virginia Tech is not executing a management and operating contract.  Therefore, it is respectfully requested for this clause to be removed.
column7: In all CR subcontracts
